quest.name: To Rule the Skies
journal: Utata seems eager to share her findings on the ghost ship.

Utata explains how she created an “ectocompass” that allows her to track the ghost ship's unique aetheric signature. Using the readings she has taken, it seems she has been able to plot a course to intercept the cursed vessel. Gather together a trusty crew, and prepare to boldly go where no sky pirate has gone before...and lived to tell the tale!

※The Void Ark can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have braved the depths of the Void Ark and lived to tell the tale. Make your way back to the Sea of Clouds.

At the heart of the Ark, you discover a massive coffin-like object, but before you can inspect it more closely, a fearsome voidsent appears, seemingly intent on your destruction. Rather than engage the creature, however, you elect to flee the violently heaving vessel at the behest of what appears to be a talking cat. Once outside in your manacutter, you are witness to an incredible spectacle: the prow of the ship splits open, and emits a blinding blast of light that tears a rent in the very sky. The belly of the vessel then ejects the huge coffin, which disappears into the gaping rift...

Speak with Leofard back at the Gauntlet, and attempt to make sense of these portentous events.

Back on solid ground, your rendezvous with Utata does not proceed as planned: Radlia and her axe-wielding brutes have taken the Redbill engineer captive. They ransom her for the ectocompass, but not before Leofard slips a linkpearl into the device's casing. Though concerned about Radlia's plans for the Ark, the Redbill captain first wishes to learn more of the cat creature─one “Cait Sith”─and of the haunted vessel upon which he dwelt.

You return to the Redbills' den, and the loquacious feline reveals his nature as a familiar. He tells the tale of High Voidmage Cessair, and of the Mhachi magi who constructed the Void Ark as a means to escape the great floods of the Sixth Umbral Calamity. Sadly for them, he continues, they proved unable to control the potent entity chosen to power the ship─whom he calls Scathach, the Shadow Queen─and were forced to contend with the horde of lesser voidsent servants that her rampant energies set loose. Though they ultimately succeeded in rebinding the creatures, they did so at the cost of their own lives, leaving Cait Sith alone to guard a derelict prison. For fifteen hundred years the Void Ark drifted, until a determined voidsent arrived on the ship and once more released its malevolent inmates, his efforts culminating in what you now understand to be the liberation of Scathach's warded tomb.

After hearing Cait Sith's story, Leofard vows to aid him in tracking down the Queen's Coffin...and collect any ancient treasures uncovered along the way. For the time being, however, the pirate captain encourages you to return to your adventures, adding that you should always keep an ear open for the Redbills' call to arms.

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: This here's Utata, the lass I was tellin' you about. She's our engineer, and a damn good one at that.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: I always get this little thrill in me chest when I'm about to embark on a new adventure. And once you've felt your heart dance like that, there's naught you wouldn't do to feel it again...

dialogue.name: LEOFARDSCONSPIRATORS02204
dialogue.text: Might be as there are better engineers in the realm, but I'd wager none are as inventive as our Utata. She earns her keep with her brains, not her brawn, and we're a stronger crew for it.

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: Well met, ladies and gentlepirates! Now that we appear to have our hero, I'm happy to report that we've overcome the last obstacle to boarding the ghost ship!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: ...Meanin' your project is proceedin' as planned?

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: That it is, Captain! I knew this would be the perfect place to take readings─the scant amounts of background aether make it easy to follow the derelict's trail.

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: The ghost ship has what Utata tells us is a “unique aetheric signature.” She's been buildin' a device what can sniff out this particular spectral flavor, and point us in the right direction.

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: I call it the “ectocompass”! It's allowed me to collect some solid data on the vessel's movements, and plot a reliable intercept course. No groping blindly through the clouds for us!

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: All the ships are loaded and ready to fly. Just say the word, Captain.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Utata, you'd best stay here, out of harm's way. Keep an eye on them aether trails, eh?

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: Aye, Captain! Grab an armload of treasure for me!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Now, we've got no way of knowin' what's waitin' for us on that cursed hulk, Forename, so you'd best bring along a few mates what you know you can trust. Don't hurt to be too careful, seein' as how you'll be goin' in first and all. I did tell you you'd be goin' in first, didn't I? I, well, you will.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: The rest of us'll be guardin' the rear, just in case Radlia and her brood decide to stick their beaks in where they ain't wanted. Don't worry, she'll not get past us, so you can concentrate on carvin' a path into the ship's belly!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text:
An honest-to-gods ghost ship...
Ohhh-ho-ho, this is gonna be an adventure and a half!

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: I'll be on hand to see that our curious captain don't get us all killed meddlin' with some ancient artifact or other─meanin' you'll be free to concentrate on not gettin' killed by whatever's waitin' belowdecks. Can't say fairer than that, eh?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: We'll deal with any sneaky bastards what try creepin' in behind us while you and your mates forge ahead. That hulk's secrets'll be ours alone.

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: Leofard will be taking my ectocompass with him. Just follow his lead, and you'll arrive at the derelict soon enough. Who knows what wondrous trinkets await you inside!?

dialogue.name: LEOFARDSCONSPIRATORS02204
dialogue.text: The captain's dragged us on some hair-raisin' ventures in his time, but summat tells me this one's gonna be the worst of the lot. If we look out for each other, though, I reckon we'll make it home in one piece...with a bit of luck.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Bugger me... I expected danger, but not a hells-spawned bleedin' nightmare made flesh like that! Didn't stop you and your mates, though, did it!? That's some crew you've got there, and no mistake.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Right, then─let's have a look inside that dirty great coffer-type...thing. Summat tells me it's filled to the brim with booty.

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: Don't look at me! I never moved a muscle!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells is that bastard doin'!?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: (-???-)This way! Swiftly now!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Er...can anyone else see that talkin' cat over there? Bloody hells, this adventure's gettin' queerer by the minute...

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: ...Still, I'd rather take me chances with a prattlin' puss than stay here. Get your things, mateys─we're leavin'!

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: But...what about the loot!?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: You can't spend it when you're dead! We either follow the furball, or make friends with a spell-slingin' voidborn! Your choice!

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: Gods damn it! How's an honest sky pirate meant to make a livin'!?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text:
The ship's breakin' up...
Is he tryin' to bring her down?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: (-???-)The voidsent is attempting to initiate a dimensional displacement! But the gate─it cannot possibly be large enough for the entire ship...

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: (-???-)<gasp> The Queen's Coffin! He takes it beyond our reach!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Well, there don't seem much point hangin' 'round here. Let's get back to solid ground.

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: What kind of cat is that anyway? And what was it doin' on that ship...?

dialogue.name: LEOFARDSCONSPIRATORS02204
dialogue.text: Ugh... Me poor heart... 'Tis a pity about the loot and no mistake, but at least we made it out in one piece. As the captain's so fond of sayin', “You can't spend it when you're dead!” <sigh>

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text:
Long has it been since my paws have trodden aught but those cursed decks...
<sigh> Would that I had made landfall under better circumstances.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Aye, 'twas a bit touch and go in places, I grant you, but here we all are, and all with our bits still attached! This calls for a foamin' flagon of─

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Hold on. Ain't we missin' someone? Didn't I tell Utata to wait for us here?

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Never fear. We've been keeping the girl company.

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: But enough about her! Did you see the cannon on that ship? As you know, my dear Leofard, I am not easily moved, but the sheer power on display set me all aquiver.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Well, I hope you're content to admire it from afar. That vessel ain't for the likes of you and me.

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: Do not presume to measure me by your own limitations. Besides, I believe I've shown how resourceful I can be.

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: Which brings me neatly to the point. You have in your possession a device capable of tracking the ghost ship. Hand it over, or your engineer shall suffer the consequences.

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: ...Perfect. A compass pointing the way to my just reward. A weapon like that belongs in the hands of one with the will to use it!

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: Come, lads. Our business here is concluded.

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Captain. They caught me off guard...

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: ...You get a bang on the head or summat? The man I know would never give in to scum like her without a fight. Unless─

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: <sigh> What did you do to the compass?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text:
Who, me? Naught.
...Besides slippin' a linkpearl into its casin', like. Hah hah! So long as Radlia keeps it close─and you can be damn sure she will─we'll know exactly what them thievin' bastards are plannin'! Anyone care to wager how long it'll take her to notice me little gift?

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: That's very clever and all, but how were you proposin' to stop her from gettin' her hands on that derelict and its great big cannon?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: I ain't worked that part out yet. But I 'spect it'll start with us keepin' a close eye on the Talons.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: 'Fore we get into any of that, though, I've got some questions what need answerin'.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: You wish to know more of the Void Ark? The “ghost ship,” as you call it?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: The Void Ark... So that's its proper name. Aye, I'd like to hear whatever you'd care to tell us, puss.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: (-Cait Sith-)And I, for my part, am curious to hear your stories. Ere we continue, however, I must insist that you address me by my proper name: Cait Sith. I will not respond to “puss” or “cat,” and most decidedly not “furball.”

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: My tale begins long, long ago in the city of Mhach, which once stood in the lands of Yafaem.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: The sorcerers of Mhach were masters of destructive magicks, and they brought that terrible power to bear against Amdapor and Nym in the War of the Magi.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: The titanic forces they unleashed, however, took a heavy toll upon the land, ultimately resulting in a colossal flood that drowned the realm of Eorzea─a catastrophe which my master, High Voidmage Cessair, was wise enough to foresee.

dialogue.name: STACIA
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait... Colossal flood? Are you talkin' about the Sixth Umbral Calamity?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: Hmm, I suppose you would know it as such... Now, where was I? Ah, yes. When they learned of the fate that awaited them, the Mhachi magi began construction of a gargantuan vessel that would bear their people to the skies, and to safety.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: The operation of the Void Ark, as the ship came to be called, was entrusted to Cessair. Prior to that, of course, my master had been a prisoner in her own home, confined for her outspoken opposition to the war...

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: So the Ark was meant as a sanctuary? Then, how did it come to be so...um... I mean, what happened to all the people? And where did all the voidsent come from?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: By what power do you imagine such a massive craft remains aloft? The energy required to raise the Ark was siphoned from over a thousand otherworldly servants sealed within the vessel.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: Advances in Mhachi sorcery were made for one reason and one reason only: cataclysmic destructive power. And the swiftest─and most dangerous─method of acquiring that power was through the enslavement of voidsent entities.

dialogue.name: UTATA
dialogue.text: So, the creatures on the derelict...they broke free from your master's control?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: At the very heart of the Ark, the voidmages had entombed a great ruler of the voidsent─Scathach, the Shadow Queen.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: But in order to control so potent a prisoner, a mage of adamant will was required. And being Mhach's preeminent sorcerer, Cessair was deemed best qualified. Were it otherwise, my master might never have been released from her own imprisonment...

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: Yet even with Cessair's peerless skill, the Shadow Queen could not long be subjugated. One after another, the lesser voidsent awoke, and ran rampant within the ship.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: In the end, Cessair and the fifty-three voidmages aboard the Ark sacrificed their own life energies to return the fiends to their coffins...leaving me, a lowly familiar, to watch over a derelict prison.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: If I remember me Umbral Eras right, the stuff you just described happened more'n fifteen hundred years past─which is a good while by anyone's measure. And since everythin' seems to have been quiet on board your boat till just recently, I'm thinkin' summat unusual must've happened to wake the inmates up. Am I warm?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: One day, a voidsent that had taken the shape of a bat flew into the ship. At first, it was little more than a nuisance that I brushed away, but the longer it remained on the Ark, the stronger it seemed to become... Eventually I could not contend with its power, and it began shattering seal after seal!

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: ...You have faced this bat-winged fiend before!? It would seem, then, that the creature survived the encounter...and that he intends to celebrate his restoration by liberating his queen.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: ...Ah, but you looked upon the true form of this fiend as he broke the chains holding the Queen's Coffin. I can only assume that he is one of Scathach's subjects, intent on bringing about her return.

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Well, that explains that, then─'cept for one small detail, namely, where the Queen's Coffin went. After it fell out of the ship's belly...I'm assumin' it didn't just disappear, right?

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: You recall the great rift that the Ark's cannon ripped in the sky? That was a voidgate.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: Such a portal opens a temporary path through the void, allowing the ship to travel almost instantaneously from one location to another. The voidsent, as you saw, only opened a gate large enough to displace the Coffin. As for the Coffin's destination, however...that is as much a mystery to me as it is to you.

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: I beseech you, conquerors of the Ark: help me find the Queen's Coffin ere the wards binding Scathach are dispelled!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Smells to me like an adventure! And who knows what ancient Mhachi treasures we might stumble on along the way!? Gods know, they'll make a nice change from all them Allagan tomestones we've been collectin'!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Aye, we'll help you. I'm not riskin' me hide for the sake of the realm, you understand, but I'll be damned if I let either Radlia or that bat-winged bastard take the freedom of the skies from me!

dialogue.name: CAITSITH
dialogue.text: You... You care only for how you might be inconvenienced!? If the Shadow Queen were to return, it would have dire consequences for this entire star!

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: Count your blessin's, furball! I said we'd help, didn't I?

dialogue.name: LEOFARD
dialogue.text: 'Fore we go rushin' off in search of that coffin, though, there's preparations to be made. You might as well get back to your usual heroical employment, Forename. I'll let you know when it's time to round up your mates again...

dialogue.name: RADLIA
dialogue.text: The time is nigh, my dear Talons. Soon, we shall seize control of the ghost ship and all its power, and rule the skies from here to the ends of the world!
